Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Clean but basic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Christopher D
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Madrid and visiting it often over the years, I have stayed at many hotels and pensiones (hostals). I now almost always stay at the San Lorenzo if I am on vacation or just need a night in Madrid before an international flight, etc. The location is perfect, right in the heart of the gay neighborhood, and close to everything. It is safe and clean. The rooms are very basic --- no luxury here-- but are very cheap. Don't get breakfast in the restaurant! The bar/cafe on the corner directly below the hostal serves great food and is much cheaper. Bottom line, if you just want somewhere to rest that's cheap but cheerful, the San Lorenzo is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but don't expect much, especially from staff”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while studying in Madrid for over a month, which led me to look for a cheap hotel. i would say that the hotel is good for its price and for its location but that's it. The rooms are extremely basic - and small - but still, quite clean. The wifi is very weak and I suggest you to go to a café rather than take breakfast there. I especially had two misfortunes that lead me to meet a few people of the management, whom, shouldn't forget that they work in hospitality! First of all, I brought a friend in order to watch a movie on my computer. This lead to a scandal as the front desk clerk accused me of basically going to sleep with this girl, which was "impossible as I had a single room". They treated my friend as a prostitute, which was extremely rude. Again, it was just a friend, for a simple DVD night. My second bad experience is that something has disappeared from my room and I believe that the maid took it. I mentioned this to the management and had a very intense talk with a manager, who was extremely rude and, instead of just saying sorry or trying to find a solution, accused me of being a liar etc... Nonetheless, if I try to stay honest, the hotel is good if you're not looking for luxury and if you're seeking a good location and good value for money... but do know that you'll be judged! I will personally, never ever step foot there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms ,good central area , basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: siyum
Reviews.Content: Great location , quiet area but central to everything . Clean but basic rooms. Decent service. Weak wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hostal”
Reviews.Author: woothorpe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over gay pride! Great location for gay area and central for city centre. A let down was NO kettle or complaments,alway take my tea and coffee . Didn't think of kettle. SO DONT FORGET YOUR KETTLE LIKE ME. Staff helpful did boil kettle and had to have at reception and that was the best place for WIFI, Very POOR in room. Breakfast not very good basic 2 x toast butter jam, madria spouge coffee or tea 1 x cup , could pay extra for english breakfast.lady who did breakfast nt the most happy person think it was just her personalty. Aircon very poor Very clean , had a 3rd floor room over looking the chucea square , little bit noisey but to be expected due to pride. Overall nice hostal for its money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: afrodyt2000
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean. The bathroom was also the same. All of my valuables were safe there including my netbook. Very basic accommodations but it was adequate for my 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: edinburghmonkey12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights with a friend. It's very basic - small rooms, limited resources. Not much choice for breakfast. Wasn't worth the EUR 200 that we paid for it. Positives - Great location - it is right on the Gran Via - In the Chueca district so lots of restaurants/bars in the area Negatives - The hotel is SO noisy. Not from the bars, but from the paper thin walls. You can hear people running and screaming all night - The hot water wasn't working the entire first day. When we first complained, they said that the pressure was too low and they had just fixed it and hot water would be available in 30 minutes. 1 hour later, no hot water, so we went back down to reception and they told us another story about how it was too cold to repair the pressure system.

Reviews.Title: “Basic good location”
Reviews.Author: beciboots
Reviews.Content: Agree with most reviews. Negative The hotel is basic and some of the rooms we saw were very small and pokey. The inner rooms seem smaller than the outer rooms. It is above local bar/clubs but the noise stopped around 2am (not particularly loud) The towels are very hard and I had to remove an outer balnket as it scratched my skin through the sheet but I have sensitive skin, hubby had no problem with it. We had breakfast one morning 4Euros for toast, coffee, cake and Orange Juice which we thought was areasnable. Lady who served was not on happy pills and we felt that we were a pain for being there. We found a cafe on the main shopping street 5 min walk from the hotel and a large slice of toast and coffee 2.45Euros so worth a walk to. Walking back to hotel late can be daunting as its near the main prostitute (outside Macdonalds) area and you are in a loacl bar area so we did feel very 'touristy'. Good points Local, cheap and you get what you pay for. Get the metro ticket 10 Euros and head from the airport. We paid 35 Euros in a taxi which we thought was extortionate. If I had wanted 5 star I would have paid 5 star. The rooms are clean and warm which is all you need. I would stay there again if I was on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: DRChurchlands
Reviews.Content: Common areas and rooms are clean and nicely decorated but my room was quite cramped and got a lot of noise from the street, even with shutters and windows closed. The location is good, near to Gran Via metro but it is on the edge of a bar and party area so you can get quite lot of noise at night. Disappointing that they didn’t have an iron that I could use. Didn’t seem particularly good value for the money, I think you would be better off at Hostal Louis XV in rooms overlooking Calle Montera – they are quieter, less cramped and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Ximenei
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, near metro Gran Via in the centre of Madrid. However, the room we stayed in was in the 1st floor, beside the kitchen and the noises and the smells were very unpleasent, specially in the mornings. In addition, the room didn't have a view, very dark and a very small. The towels were a little rough but overall it was fairly clean. The worst was the attitude of the woman who waited the breakfast, who was very rude and impolite. It has to be said that the rest of the staff were very diligent, specially Javier, the night concierge and the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MP_2011_11
Reviews.Content: Modern, smart rooms and a great location make this an ideal place to stay for seeing the sights in Madrid. Free wifi throughout and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Central. Clean. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Rugbysw11
Reviews.Content: I arrived after booking an upgraded room - not the case. It was lower down, nearer the street, and noisy. I asked to be down graded and was given a very nice room 3 floors up, balcony door that opened overlookign the square. lots of storage, clean. No air conditioning - this was august - so if you can cope with the heat, its OK. Noisy at night - but I was out late - and it didnt stop me sleeping. Downpoint - leaving your key at reception. Felt a little un-trusted. People were friendly, helpful. Didnt eat there - too many good places nearby. Great for the gay scene.

Reviews.Title: “would't go there again”
Reviews.Author: gahl_54
Reviews.Content: very noisy hotel, thin walls probably stuff not friendly, but most of them speaks english very small rooms, decorated quite badly very good location, between chueca and gran via

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel to relax with your family”
Reviews.Author: Gilbertfung
Reviews.Content: I went to Hostal San Lorenzo in summer 2007 with my parents and sister, and it was a nice and comfortable experience. We stayed for 4 nights and the bedroom was always spotlessly clean, daily bed sheets change and fresh towels every day. We got an amazing room with 1 queensize bed for my parents and 2 single beds for me and my sister in a connected separate room with doors to provide some privacy to my parents. Our room has a balcony that overlooks the streets and has "automatic curtains" with a remote control and the rooms has AC. The staff are helpful and the lobby has a computer that you can use to do a quick check of your e-mails. The only thing I didn't like is its location because it is situated near the gay/lesbian clubs and was pretty noisy during the nights when they're partying and gay/lesbians couples kissing on the streets might introduce bad influence towards the younger children. The plus side, is that the security is very well done there with 24 hr security men staying in the lobby and cameras in the elevators and corridors. Also the price is also very cheap for this convenient location in the centre of Madrid. Also it's a heaven for women who loves shopping hundreds of shoe shops and fashion boutiques nearby since the hotel is near the busy streets of Gran Via, and the prices are reasonable too since it's where the locals shop.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, but a bit noisy to go with it.”
Reviews.Author: Roy Little
Reviews.Content: Just back from a couple of days at the hostal San Lorenzo. The hostal was easy enough to find once we got off the metro and the staff were very quick at getting us booked in. All members of staff we spoke to were fluent in English, so we had no problems there. The twin rooms we booked were adequate without being stunning, but they were very clean and gave the impression of being very secure. As we were only there for 2 nights, it's really difficult to draw any bad conclusions from the hostal. As has been said before, the fact that you're just off a main thoroughfare makes it a bit noisy in the evening (a Madrid evening starts about 11pm and finishes about 6am the next morning). So if you're a light sleeper, I'd suggest taking ear plugs along. All in, a good place to stay if you're looking to be in the thick of things, but a wee bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Get What you Pay for”
Reviews.Author: KMARNELL
Reviews.Content: I am a single staright male.I stayed for one night at a good price. SAN LORENZO is in a great central location. The walls are thin so you here noise if there is any. I stayed on monday night so it was ok. The only reason I would not like to stay again is that there is No Fire Escape and as smoking is permitted this adds to the danger. But its fine other than that with lovely honest helpful staff. I dont think a fire escape would cost much and then I feel it would be a great spot to base yourself for a few days. Kevin

Reviews.Title: “Discriminatory rude [--] !”
Reviews.Author: foxsmjr
Reviews.Content: I arrived carrying several bags, as I have been studying in Madrid for 2 months and have acquired many things. Upon checking in alone, I was given a key to my room. My friend, who was getting food at a local store, came up to my room and helped my unpack. We left, and went thru the lobby together (they have the elevator rigged so that you must always stop on the lobby level, and they can see in the elevator), where they require you to leave your key... I was soon to find out why. The lady who checked me in gave me and my friend a strange look. When we returned 2 hrs later, she began to immediately tell her co-worker something, and then they refused to allow my friend to come up to my room with me with out us paying an additional 40 euro ($64). Obviously I was shocked, and asked why. They said the room was reserved for one person. I tried to explain to them that my friend lived here, and offer his ID, but they refused any visit and said I either pay or stay in the lobby. So, we left and went to a bar. I couldn't believe how cheap this place is... what hotel doesn't let your friends in your room for a bit? How many times have you traveled and just met people and invited them over? Or had someone come hangout for a bit in the room before going somewhere else? Later, I was using the cpu in the lobby, and noticed several other couples enter together, and no questions at all were asked. It then became obvious to me that the management was under the impression that I was just using the room for an hr by hr type of thing... Very rude... I would never stay here again. Ps.. the location is not that great... there is a very busy plaza next to the hotel that is very loud till 3 am... and that was from Tues to Thurs night. Also, the floors are all stone, so you can hear everything in everyone's room. P.O.S. ! Stay Away

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Glasgow_1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding for the price. I stayed at the Hostel Lorenzo with my girlfriend for 5 nights in July 2007 and paid 390EUR. It was in an excellent location and easy walking distance to the city centre, tourist sights, restaurants and bars. The room and en-suite bathroom were modern, exceptionally clean and a good size. The room also had air conditioning, a small TV and music available from a ceiling mounted speaker. The staff were very pleasant and the reception was manned 24/7. The hotel breakfast was basic but good and was excellent value at 3.50EUR. There were also drinks available from a bar (of sorts) and a free internet terminal. I am unsure why this place was termed as a hostel because I have stayed in far poorer “hotels”. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would definitely go back here if I was in Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveThePubsinger
Reviews.Content: The San Lorenzo is a 3* hotel located in a very good position just off the Gran Vía (close to the Sol area of Madrid). The hotel is served by a small but modern lift which goes from the ground floor lobby to all floors above. Reception is a spacious area on the first floor where maps, newspapers and mini-cards (offering discounts on local restaurants/attractions) are available together with a computer offering free internet access for guests. There is a breakfast/bar area to the side and a small luggage room which can be overlooked by reception staff at all times. Staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English (as well as other languages). We booked a double room but were given a triple which was a nice, light, good-sized room with plenty of cupboard/drawer space, TV (Spanish channels only) and a safe. The bathroom was small but clean and (looked) new. Towels were changed frequently. Our room overlooked the square and had two tiny balconies from which you could people-watch. (Note: even with the balcony doors locked, you could hear the noise from people in the square in the late evening/night – this went on especially late at weekends). A menu card detailing breakfasts offered at 3 and 5 euros (available 8am – 10am) seemed reasonable value though we did not try any of them. The San Lorenzo is a little more expensive than our usual holiday accommodation and we felt that considering the small price of the breakfast this could have been included in the room rate, however as we needed a room for a few nights at short notice we were happy to pay the 85 euros + tax (per night) and felt the standard of the hotel warranted the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal San Lorenzo.? Think well before you book.”
Reviews.Author: Debora M
Reviews.Content: Our experience in this hostal (not a hotel !) proves that the best location should not be always the main reference when we plan where to stay. The cleanness is probably the best label that Hostal San Lorenzo has to offer. Unfortunately, in the whole appreciation this good remark is ruined by a “bouquet” of bad, even intolerable behaviour, showing us that the hotel industry is not for everyone. Adding to this we have to list the location. The team management and the staff of this place have a lot to learn in order to understand that hotel business is incompatible with some, let’s say, “greedy” actions. I’d like to encourage both (the staff and the managers) to read, for instance, what J. Marriott teaches in his Spirit to serve: the Marriot’s way. It would be useful, once it seems that they don’t know the real meaning of these services. Let’s go to the facts: 1) We’ve booked a double superior for 6 nights. They assigned us room 211. This room was only a normal double (1st trap), but we were so exhausted that we’ve decided to postpone the matter for the next day. The following morning, after complaining in the front desk, they reassigned room 109. In fact it was a double superior; but far away from the example showed in the website! (2nd trap) 2) The price for a double superior room is € 89,00, if paid in money. But if paid with credit card you have to add 7% (3rd trap, once they should clearly mention the real price in its website, with or without taxes). 3) Other considerations: a) Each use of the safety deposit is charged with € 1, 00! We’ve been in hotels in Europe and outside, and this was the first time we faced this creative talent to make money. (When we moved from 211 to 109, of course, we lost our euro). b) About the staff: - They tried to argue that the 211 is a double superior! They had the impertinence to try to convince us that the square meters from each room are different from one to another. No doubt! But Room 211 definitely is a normal double, not a superior. It’s very small for 2 people and there is not space for the luggage. You have to open it over the beds. - The majority of the staff is not very friendly. But this is, more and more, normal in Madrid (restaurants, bars, hotels, museums, shops). We prefer to say that they need professional training in order to receive the customers with sympathy and cheeriness, essential attributes to this profession. - Last but not least: the place is very noisy, and unless you sleep like a stone, you’ll wake several times in the night:. Causes? The street noise until late and the disco sound until 5, 30 in the morning. Wherever you sleep in this establishment, it’s hard to avoid it. Think well, very well, before you dare to book this Hostal San Lorenzo.

Reviews.Title: “Wall to Wall beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location--we could walk every where!! However, we did get ripped off by the cab driver coming from the airport--he charged us 40 euros for the ride! The staff personel were very helpful and nice. The room was the biggest disaster! We had a family room which according to the hotel would sleep 4 people comfortably! What it had was 2 twin beds with 2 cots thrown in the floor space that was left! We had to literally crawl over beds to get around!! All this for 95 euros--we won't do that again! Definitely skip the hotel breakfast and coffee--not worth it at all. You can find much better very close by. I would not recommend this hotel to a family. It will work well for business or for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is to be AVOIDED by any means. When reserved online we had to to pay a fee of 30 Euro for this "service, which will NOT be paid back if there are any problems [and there were a lot) When we arrived they gave us a room the size of a toilet.There was a major construction going on outside which was so loud you couldn't hear your own words. The blinds were broken, so you couldn't close it nor make it dark. It was so hot outside [June] that we asked to turn on the air condition [it is turned on by them!] but we were told that for that you have to pay an extra fee [????]They advertise all room having air-condition] When we ask for the manager to please explain all this, they treated us with total disrespect. We asked for our money back with no result.Then we looked around in the same plaza for other hotels/hostals, they all had a much higher standard and were HALF the price of this one.AVOID THIS PLACE BY ANY MEANS.NOT TO BE RECOMMENDED. BIG TOURIST TRAP!!!

Reviews.Title: “All right for a budget traveller.....”
Reviews.Author: mattyjnz
Reviews.Content: Hotel was pretty basic and would suit those on a budget. Our room was right above the street and it was very noisy, only stayed one night, thank god and did not really sleep at all. Unless you are not on a budget, I would suggest you find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well-run hostal in an amazing location just off the Gran Via in Cheuca. BUT the room we had was miniscule and right on a very, very noisy street, so we barely slept for 2 of the 4 nights we were there. Hotel was fully booked so we couldn't move to another room. I'd ask for a large interior room, although those may be dark.

Reviews.Title: “liked our stay”
Reviews.Author: mrsfig
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff and inexpensive. A bit hard to find, on a very small street but located close to main avenue and metro. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Lorenzo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Inexpensive, very clean, lovely staff. It is an old building with 3 foot thick stone walls to the outside. They have double-paned the balcony doors so that no noise comes in even when your room is practically at street level. Heat in winter. A/C in summer (although we weren't there in summer, each unit had its own A/C). Off Gran Via. Walking distance to the Prado, Puerto del Sol, Placa Majora. Wonderful.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal San Lorenzo
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Clavel 8, 28004 Madrid, Spain
